007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016
017/**
018   Clip in camera space any {@link LineSegment} that crosses the
019   camera's near clipping plane {@code z = -near}. Interpolate
020   {@link Vertex} color from any clipped off {@link Vertex} to
021   the new {@link Vertex}.
022<p>
023   This clipping algorithm is a simplification of the Liang-Barsky
024   Parametric Line Clipping algorithm.
025*/
026public final class NearClip_Line
027{
028   /**
029      If the {@link LineSegment} crosses the camera's near plane,
030      then return a clipped version that is contained in the far
031      side of the near plane. The new, clipped {@link LineSegment}
032      object is returned wrapped in a {@link List} object.
033      <p>
034      One new clipped {@link Vertex} object may be added to the
035      {@link Model}'s vertex list and one new interpolated
036      {@link Color} object may be added to the model's color list.
037      <p>
038      If the {@link LineSegment} is completely on the camera side
039      of the near plane, then return an empty {@link List} object
040      to indicate that the {@link LineSegment} should be discarded
041      from the model's {@link Primitive} list.
042
043      @param model   {@link Model} that the {@link LineSegment} {@code ls} comes from
044      @param ls      {@link LineSegment} to be clipped
045      @param camera  {@link Camera} that determines the near clipping plane
046      @return a clipped version of {@code ls} wrapped in an {@link List} object
047   */
048   public static List<Primitive> clip(final Model model,
049                                      final LineSegment ls,
050                                      final Camera camera)
051   {
052      // Make local copies of several values.
053      final double n = camera.n;
054
055      final int vIndex0 = ls.vIndexList.get(0);
056      final int vIndex1 = ls.vIndexList.get(1);
057      final Vertex v0 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex0);
058      final Vertex v1 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex1);
059
060      final double z0 = v0.z;
061      final double z1 = v1.z;
062
063      // 1. Check for trivial accept.
064      if ( z0 <= n && z1 <= n ) // on the far side of the near plane z = n
065      {
066         if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Near_Clip: Trivial accept.");
067         return java.util.Arrays.asList(ls); // better than "return ls;"
068      }
069      // 2. Check for trivial delete.
070      if ( z0 > n && z1 > n ) // on the near side of the near plane z = n
071      {
072         if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Near_Clip: Trivial delete.");
073         return new ArrayList<Primitive>(); // better than "return null;"
074      }
075      // 3. Need to clip this line segment.
076      else // crosses the near plane z = n
077      {
078         return java.util.Arrays.asList(interpolateNewVertex(model, ls, n));
079      }
080   }
081
082
083   /**
084      This method takes a line segment with one vertex on the near
085      side of the near clipping plane (in front of clipping plane)
086      and the other vertex on the far side of the near clipping plane
087      (behind the clipping plane).
088      <p>
089      This method returns the line segment from the clipping plane to the
090      vertex on the far side of the clipping plane.
091      <p>
092      This method solves for the value of {@code t} for which the z-component
093      of the parametric equation
094      <pre>{@code
095                  p(t) = (1 - t) * v0 + t * v1
096      }</pre>
097      intersects the given clipping plane, {@code z = n}. The solved for
098      value of {@code t} is then plugged into the x and y components of the
099      parametric equation to get the coordinates of the intersection point.
100
101      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link LineSegment} {@code ls} comes from
102      @param ls     the {@link LineSegment} being clipped
103      @param n      the z-coordinate of the near clipping plane
104      @return the index of the new interpolated {@link Vertex} object
105   */
106   private static LineSegment interpolateNewVertex(final Model model,
107                                                   final LineSegment ls,
108                                                   final double n)
109   {
110      // Make local copies of several values.
111      final int vIndex0 = ls.vIndexList.get(0);
112      final Vertex v0  = model.vertexList.get(vIndex0);
113      final double v0x = v0.x;
114      final double v0y = v0.y;
115      final double v0z = v0.z;
116      final int cIndex0 = ls.cIndexList.get(0);
117      float c0[] = model.colorList.get(cIndex0).getRGBColorComponents(null);
118
119      final int vIndex1 = ls.vIndexList.get(1);
120      final Vertex v1  = model.vertexList.get(vIndex1);
121      final double v1x = v1.x;
122      final double v1y = v1.y;
123      final double v1z = v1.z;
124      final int cIndex1 = ls.cIndexList.get(1);
125      float c1[] = model.colorList.get(cIndex1).getRGBColorComponents(null);
126
127      // Interpolate between v1 and v0.
128      final double t = (n - v1z) / (v0z - v1z);
129
130      // Use the value of t to interpolate the coordinates of the new vertex.
131      final double x = (1 - t) * v1x + t * v0x;
132      final double y = (1 - t) * v1y + t * v0y;
133      final double z = n;
134
135      // Use the value of t to interpolate the color of the new vertex.
136      final float t_ = (float)t;
137      final float r = (1 - t_) * c1[0] + t_ * c0[0];
138      final float g = (1 - t_) * c1[1] + t_ * c0[1];
139      final float b = (1 - t_) * c1[2] + t_ * c0[2];
140
141      // Modify the Model to contain the new Vertex.
142      final Vertex newVertex = new Vertex(x, y, z);
143      final int vIndexNew = model.vertexList.size();
144      model.vertexList.add(newVertex);
145
146      // Modify the Model to contain the new Color.
147      final Color newColor = new Color(r, g, b);
148      final int cIndexNew = model.colorList.size();
149      model.colorList.add(newColor);
150
151      // Which Vertex of ls is on the near side of the clipping plane?
152      final int vNearIndex;
153      if ( v0z > n ) // clip off v0
154      {
155         vNearIndex = 0;
156      }
157      else // clip off v1
158      {
159         vNearIndex = 1;
160      }
161
162      if (Clip.debug)
163      {
164         final String vClipped = (0==vNearIndex) ? "v0" : "v1";
165         logMessage(String.format("-- Clip off %s at z=%.3f",
166                                        vClipped, n));
167         logMessage(String.format("-- t = %.25f", t));
168         logMessage(String.format("-- <x0, y0, z0> = <% .8f, % .8f, % .8f",
169                                       v0x, v0y, v0z));
170         logMessage(String.format("-- <x1, y1, z1> = <% .8f, % .8f, % .8f",
171                                       v1x, v1y, v1z));
172         logMessage(String.format("-- <x,  y,  z>  = <% .8f, % .8f, % .8f",
173                                       x,  y,  z));
174         logMessage(String.format("-- <r0, g0, b0> = <%.8f, %.8f, %.8f>",
175                                       c0[0], c0[1], c0[2]));
176         logMessage(String.format("-- <r1, g1, b1> = <%.8f, %.8f, %.8f>",
177                                       c1[0], c1[1], c1[2]));
178         logMessage(String.format("-- <r,  g,  b>  = <%.8f, %.8f, %.8f>",
179                                       r,  g,  b));
180      }
181
182      final LineSegment result;
183      if (0 == vNearIndex)
184      {
185         result = new LineSegment(vIndexNew, vIndex1, cIndexNew, cIndex1);
186      }
187      else
188      {
189         result = new LineSegment(vIndex0, vIndexNew, cIndex0, cIndexNew);
190      }
191      return result;
192   }
193
194
195
196   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
197   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
198   private NearClip_Line() {
199      throw new AssertionError();
200   }
201}
